meanings.definition: The state or condition of being unhealthy.
meanings.sent1: The unhealthinesses of the polluted air made it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the unhealthinesses of her diet and decided to eat more fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The unhealthinesses of the situation were evident when everyone got sick after the party.
meanings.sent4: The unhealthinesses of the relationship between the two countries led to tension and conflict.
meanings.sent5: The doctor warned about the unhealthinesses of smoking, emphasizing the risks to the lungs.

meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of lacking good health.
meanings.sent1: The unhealthinesses of his skin indicated a lack of proper care.
meanings.sent2: The unhealthinesses of the water supply raised concerns among the residents.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, the unhealthinesses of his lifestyle were hard to ignore.
meanings.sent4: The unhealthinesses of the old building were evident in the peeling paint and mold.
meanings.sent5: She felt the unhealthinesses of her body after weeks of neglecting exercise and sleep.

meanings.definition: The presence of factors that are detrimental to health.
meanings.sent1: The unhealthinesses of the workplace included poor ventilation and high stress levels.
meanings.sent2: The unhealthinesses of the food served at the event caused many guests to feel unwell.
meanings.sent3: The unhealthinesses of the city's infrastructure became apparent during the heatwave.
meanings.sent4: She could sense the unhealthinesses of the relationship based on constant arguments and tension.
meanings.sent5: The doctor identified the unhealthinesses of the patient's lifestyle choices and recommended changes for better health.
